The district is monitoring the developing information related to the spread of COVID-19 (commonly referred to as the coronavirus). To date, the district is unaware of any native cases of COVID-19 being reported in our state. div.em: Current conditions as of 29 Apr 11:35 am CDT

div.div: Mostly sunny, with a high near 65. Windy, with a north northwest wind 25 to 30 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 40. Breezy, with a north wind 15 to 20 mph decreasing to 5 to 10 mph in the evening. Winds could gust as high as 25 mph.
Sunny, with a high near 76. West wind 5 to 10 mph becoming south in the afternoon.

p.input: Website Navigation As Staff Page Only

div.div: Your session will expire in 0 minutes.

p.b: The district is monitoring the developing information related to the spread of COVID-19 (commonly referred to as the coronavirus). To date, the district is unaware of any native cases of COVID-19 being reported in our state. However, the district has reviewed its relevant policies and procedures and is confident that it is prepared to respond to any outbreak of communicable disease that may occur. Should this situation interfere with the district’s ordinary operations or schedule, you will be provided notice in the customary fashion.

We encourage you to remain informed about the spread of the coronavirus, and would recommend that you visit the website for the Department of Health and Human Services, found here, for further information as it develops. We would also encourage you to use this opportunity to remind your students of the importance of getting rest and washing hands, especially during cold and flu season.

If your student is showing any symptoms of flu or COVID-19, please contact the school and keep your student home until your health care provider indicates that returning to school is safe. We would much rather prefer to have your student miss some school opposed to exposing others to potential illness
You should hyperlink “here” to take readers to the relevant page from your state, and update the name of the respective agency as necessary. For convenience, we’ve produced the links here:
Nebraska Department of Health and Human Services
Contact the school if you have any additional questions or concerns, 402-849-2238.

div.a: We like to hear your feedback!
Its never too early to schedule your school and sports physicals!
This institution is an equal opportunity provider.
